commit.title: [micromega] Workaround bug / discordance in gcd calculation.
commit.message:
[micromega] Workaround bug / discordance in gcd calculation.

Indeed, you could argue that the bug is in micromega as the GCD
of (0,X) is ought not to be defined IIRC.

The problem arises from:
```
utop # Big_int_Z.(gcd_big_int zero_big_int unit_big_int);;
Exception: Division_by_zero.

utop # Big_int.(gcd_big_int zero_big_int unit_big_int);;
- : Big_int.big_int = <big_int 1>
```

commit.message:
[micromega] Workaround bug / discordance in gcd calculation.

Indeed, you could argue that the bug is in micromega as the GCD
of (0,X) is ought not to be defined IIRC.

The problem arises from:
```
utop # Big_int_Z.(gcd_big_int zero_big_int unit_big_int);;
Exception: Division_by_zero.

utop # Big_int.(gcd_big_int zero_big_int unit_big_int);;
- : Big_int.big_int = <big_int 1>
```

commit.title: [micromega] Workaround bug / discordance in gcd calculation.
commit.message:
[micromega] Workaround bug / discordance in gcd calculation.

Indeed, you could argue that the bug is in micromega as the GCD
of (0,X) is ought not to be defined IIRC.

The problem arises from:
```
utop # Big_int_Z.(gcd_big_int zero_big_int unit_big_int);;
Exception: Division_by_zero.

utop # Big_int.(gcd_big_int zero_big_int unit_big_int);;
- : Big_int.big_int = <big_int 1>
```
